attributes.action: reinstate Professor David Nutt to the Advisory Council on the Misuse of Drugs, ACMD
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government sacked Professor Nutt, its chief drugs adviser, on 30 October and accused him of undermining its anti-drugs campaign after he argued that ecstasy, cannabis and LSD were less harmful than alcohol.

Home Secretary Alan Johnson said Professor David Nutt, head of the country drugs advisory body, had overstepped his role and strayed into politics.

Nutt accused the government of ignoring scientific evidence to back its "moral" drive against drugs, while Johnson said the advisor had damaged its message about their dangers.

We call upon the Prime Minister to issue an immediate apology and re-instate Professor Nutt.

We call upon the to Prime Minister to accept the recommendations and advice of its expert committees on drugs.
